q: What is Inara Technologies?
a: A privately held IT & services company based in Islamabad, Pakistan, delivering telecom, cloud, media‑delivery, security, DevOps, and analytics solutions since 2013.

q: When was Inara Technologies founded?
a: It was founded in 2013.

q: Where is Inara Technologies located?
a: Suite #11, 2nd Floor, Select Centre, F‑11 Markaz, Islamabad, Pakistan.

q: What type of company is Inara Technologies?
a: It is a privately held company.

q: What is the size of the company?
a: It has between 51 and 200 employees.

q: Which industries does Inara serve?
a: IT & services, telecom, oil & gas, education, and other network industries.

q: What core expertise does Inara offer?
a: Expertise in service‑provider networks, OSS/BSS, media delivery, virtualization & cloud, enterprise systems.

q: What networking services does Inara provide?
a: IP transport networks, QoS, FTTH, SONET, DWDM, Carrier Ethernet, OTN, and wireless deployment.

q: What media delivery solutions are available?
a: Live TV, catch‑up, nPVR, VOD with full middleware, CDN, DRM, encoder, and set‑top box integration.

q: What cloud services does Inara offer?
a: Public, private, and hybrid cloud deployment with intelligent orchestration and workload placement.

q: What managed services does Inara provide?
a: Network operations, security services, media‑delivery operations, all under SLA.

q: How does analytics feature in their offerings?
a: They use AI and ML to analyze data, predict behaviors, and extract deeper business insights.

q: What is their development approach?
a: Early adoption of a “Software‑First” DevOps culture.

q: Who is the CEO of Inara Technologies?
a: Co‑Founder & CEO is Nauman Ullah Khan.

q: Who is the CTO or technical director?
a: Co‑Founder & Director Technical is Hilal Afridi.

q: What is ICAS?
a: Irrigation & Climate Advisory Services – an IoT + satellite + weather platform for farmers.

q: Where was ICAS showcased internationally?
a: At the ADB Water & Urban Development Forum in Manila, May 27–30, 2025.

q: Which partners collaborated on ICAS?
a: PCRWR and the Asian Disaster Preparedness Center (ADPC).

q: What technologies power ICAS?
a: IoT soil sensors, satellite ETa/CWR models, hyper‑local forecasts, mobile advisory app.

q: What is the Event Hub app?
a: A paperless event‑management mobile/web app for RHINOCON 2025 in Lahore.

q: What features does Event Hub include?
a: Session info, galleries, speaker profiles, schedule, FAQs, feedback, and notifications.

q: What companies partner with Inara for media solutions?
a: Middleware/CDN/DRM and encoder/set‑top box vendors (partners unspecified).

q: What multi‑vendor environments do they support?
a: Integration & optimization of multi‑vendor, multi‑technology telecom and datacenter environments.

q: What virtualization technologies are used?
a: Likely VMware, Citrix, KVM, plus cloud‑native stacks.

q: Who is Naveed Iqbal?
a: A Project Management Specialist in telecom/IoT at Inara.

q: Who is Nasir Abbas?
a: A Business Consultant on Inara’s business development team.

q: Who is Gohar Tasneem Shaikh?
a: Director of Solution Engineering at Inara.

q: How does Inara integrate DevOps?
a: By embedding DevOps early in their software delivery to streamline operations.

q: What OSS/BSS systems do they support?
a: They design and integrate OSS/BSS for telecom operators.

a: Estimated under $1 M USD.
